comment: I absolutely loved the concept of the Nintendo Switch and decided to get one due to its popular demand. It‚Äôs pretty awesome and best to get it at the normal price of $299.99 because it really isn‚Äôt worth $300.00+ and it really refreshes the gaming atmosphere. However, handheld mode is so enormous that it‚Äôs a little uncomfortable. I was on the fence about buying this or the Nintendo Switch Lite, because I rarely have anyone else around to play some really cool multiplayer games like Mario Kart 8 Deluxe or Super Smash Bros. Plus, the Switch Lite doesn‚Äôt come with controller/joy con problems and is smaller, more comfortable, and accessible. One other thing that stands out on the Lite is it has a smaller screen but games look a bit sharper on it. That said, some of the free games are pretty addictive! I think it was totally worth the $300.00, but it does cost $20 to buy Nintendo Online to play any Nintendo game‚Äôs online player. I also wouldn‚Äôt recommend buying a Pro controller because the joy con controller is pretty comfortable, so far. If you‚Äôre someone who loves hanging around friends and family, get the regular Switch. If you‚Äôre a solo and lone wolf type of badass, get the Switch Lite!

Love my new Nintendo Switch Animal Crossing version. I have been waiting for over a year for this. I originally ordered the regular version but it never came so I went to reorder and found that this was finally available. So glad I finally got it. After a year I would have taken anything...my luck - this one was available. So easy to set up. So easy to use. So very happy with the Amazon customer service and the Nintendo Switch. Don‚Äôt buy from scalpers who buy cheap and jack up the price. Just wait patiently. Worth the wait.

Spent a lot of time looking to find a switch that wasn‚Äôt overpriced, and after doing lots of refreshing and looking at stock informer sites, I was finally able to purchase one. Is in perfect condition, brand new, and delivered on time! Definitely worth the wait of getting it at standard pricing, now to spend countless hours playing ACNH!

Wonderful product. There are many minor hiccups that I already knew of before purchasing this product e.g. joycon drift, shakey joycons, hot while docked, online connectivity, dock scratch, etc. However, most of these risks i knew well ahead of time and so I was not bothered by them as most already have a diy fix for them as discovered by the Switch community. Great product, do some research before purchasing one, Nintendo methodology in developing their products can be a little strange at times but the good outweighs the bad with this product.
This is the most beautiful thing I‚Äôve ever held in my hands as a die hard AC fan.

After owning the original Wii for years and enjoying it with 0 problems I decided on getting the Switch, even though I mainly play my games on PC now a days, I thought it would be a great console for my wife and I to come together every now and then to play. I was lucky to score one when Nintendo finally got it back in stock after months of no stock because of the pandemic. The first day I got it the right (red) joy con kept disconnecting every 5-10 minutes. I was literally 5 feet away from the console with line of sight. After going through the troubleshooting steps of disconnecting joy cons and updating the console OS and controller firmware, it still had the same problem. The left (blue) joy con worked flawlessly. I searched online and found hundreds if not thousands of posts about people experiencing disconnecting joy cons and various work-arounds. Some even claimed that by having your foot propped up in front of the line of sight would cause all sorts of controller issues including lag and disconnects. So I did my long hours of testing, purchasing new official joy cons, and 3rd parties and am discouraged by my findings.Ultimately I found that the built-in bluetooth radio in the switch is just not powerful enough. Considering the amount of posts regarding controller pairing and disconnects issues, I would say the problem has been known for a long time. And instead of Nintendo recalling or replacing their poorly designed consoles they blame the environment or user error. They state things like "make sure your console is away from wireless devices of any kind". Seriously? Everyone has 20 wireless devices in their house from cell phones, routers, modems, smart TV's, wireless speakers, smart hubs, Alexa devices, the list goes on. Nintendo even states to keep the Switch away from fish tanks. Really? Soon they'll be saying to keep the switch away from air and light.I contacted Nintendo within the first week I got the Switch after getting fed up with dying because of constant controller lag and disconnects. Tier 1 support is a joke. They just want you to send it in which customer pays for shipping, and I may get my console back in 30 days. So after back and forth discussion with Tier 1 support I finally found that there is an escalation line which they forwarded me to which seems to be a line of seniors or assistant managers. Again they wanted me to send in the console. I called BS and explained that the console was only a week old. We finally agreed that I would temporarily pay for a replacement right joy con, and only after they received my defective right joy con that I would get reimbursed. New right joy con came, had the same problems albeit it was less noticeable, less disconnects. I sent my old one to them and it took them 30 days to refund my money which was $50 because they had to inspect the controller for any damage or mods. Seriously? I eventually got my money back but what a pain.Fast forward about a month and lag and disconnects are still happening. I purchased a brand new official joy con from Amazon and even though it hasn't outright disconnected it has shown lag issues again, sitting 5 feet away from the console and with direct line of sight. I even started unplugging wireless devices like my wireless speaker, just to see if anything would increase the controllers range and reliability and nothing helped.At the end of the day the Nintendo Switch is riddled with controller issues and I am not even getting into the whole "drifting" problem that people are suing Nintendo over. Now a days it seems that companies just release untested unreliable electronics, even the all and might Nintendo company, and don't take responsibility for it. A player needs reliable controllers to play a consoles content AKA joy con controllers for the Nintendo Switch, like a player needs a reliable mouse and keyboard for playing PC games. And for the price tag of an official Nintendo Switch joy con set at around $70 I expect them to be flawless, and their from from it. And this console isn't even new. It's been out for several years and Nintendo has had plenty of time to fix their issues, and they have chosen to blame us, the consumers instead of taking ownership of the problem.I plan to exchange the Switch for another using the Amazon exchange policy. Luckily, my purchase qualified for the holiday return policy so I have until February 1st to return it. If the new one acts up the same way I will be returning it and will be calling my credit card company to reimburse the 4 games I purchased from the Switch store since the Nintendo store has a no refund policy, which is a complete joke and such a policy should be discouraged.

On paper this is such a slick device, and combined with great Nintendo titles this was something I was excited for. BUT this system just isn't there yet. Right now I'm dealing with input lag that goes beyond controller or title specific issues. Right from the get go, setting it up (while in portable mode) felt odd. The touch screen and the attached joy-cons felt a bit slow. The input lag was the same speed as my PS4 with my TVs game mode OFF. Not a huge deal for many who will play most casual games, but annoying enough for me that titles like Cuphead and Enter the Gungeon are hindered. I do wonder if the newer portable only version doesn't have these issues, but I'm mainly interested in this as a home console.And it's online component? They still haven't caught up with Xbox Live from the 360 generation. Not a huge problem with Discord around, but still.Lot's of pluses for this system for sure, but this is mainly a message to people to try out the system first and decide for yourself if the input lag is bad enough to ruin your experience. A lot of people are very satisfied and don't even notice. I can see this not being a problem in games like Pokemon, or Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle. I've been playing "The Touryst", charming, relaxing, and a nice change of pace from what I usually play.

The switch is already of my favorite consoles I‚Äôve ever owned. As an adult-I‚Äôve been surprised by how much I play it in handheld mode. It‚Äôs nice to be able to sneak in some gaming time here and there at work when there is some downtime. And I actually find myself playing it in handheld mode pretty often at home when I‚Äôm watching football on the weekends. I‚Äôm glad I waited until this model with the improved battery life came out. Sometimes, I don‚Äôt have to put it on the dock to charge for 5 or 6 days, assuming I‚Äôm playing 30 minutes here and there. I highly recommend this system.
Almost everything about this console is perfect but the joy cons are flawed and Nintendo continues to ship the defective line as standard issue in switch and switch lite

The game system we received is the newer one with better battery life. However, we've been disappointed with the joys cons. Both right joy cons in the included one and another set we bought would disconnect. If you read online there are all kinds of issues with the joy cons ever since they made the system. There are fewer problems since they updated them, however, the joy cons we received with this system are dated 2017, before they updated them. So, new game system, old joy cons. Seriously disappointed in this. Nintendo is in the process of setting up a warranty repair, but I shouldn't have to do this for a brand new system. The individual set we bought is going back and we purchased new ones in a local store that should theoretically be newer. To initiate the repair Nintendo asked about a hundred questions and 2 hours later the repair is accepted. Not a good setup, in my opinion.

I‚Äôm not much of a video game person, but my boyfriend convinced me to buy the switch. I love it! I see why all the hype haha. Very easy to bring around too. I like how I get to play by myself, play with a group when I have guests over, or play overcook with my boo to get some laughters in.

Im a pc gamer but i wanted a portable console to play my rpgs and single player games when im in bed.The convenience of the switch has helped me relax after many stressful sweaty fps, or competitive games i play.I havent owned a nintendo product since the launch of the ds light and im pretty happy with this product and the colorscheme.Im 26 and will never be to old to enjoy my console.

My switch came in a lot earlier than I was expecting it to so I am over the moon with that! Not to mention that it came in perfect condition (I bought it in New condition but was feeling a little suspicious about it, not going to lie) Everything is working wonderfully right now so I really can't complain at all about the product itself. I definitely paid WAY too much for it (over $500 with tax) but if you're looking for a switch now in this quarantine time, you'll know there's a serious shortage of available consoles. All in all, definitely recommend buying if you're as impatient to get it as I was.

Product came the first day of the projected arrival timeframe which was an exciting surprise! Packaging was USPS in a sturdy USPS box and taped very well with "do not break seal" type packaging tape which I really appreciated. Product came as advertised in Nintendo box, brand new, all main gaming system components and accessories still in plastic wrap and scratch resistant wrap. I'm very very happy with this purchase!! It was purchased as a gift to a family member as a way to help with the stress of all that's going on and I couldn't be happier with my order! Thank you!

I bought this just to play Animal Crossing: New Horizons, and it didn't disappoint in the least! It's incredibly fun!One cool feature is that if you set up Parental Control using the free app, it will tell you how long you've played each day. Since I'm neither a parent nor do I need to be controlled, I disable restrictions and play-time limit so it doesn't actually interfere when I'm playing, but it is a bit sobering to see that yesterday I played for 6 hrs and 40 min.Also, if you set the play-time limit to 0 min everyday, the console will prompt you to disable Parental Control via a PIN. This could come in very handy if you have a sibling or roommate who likes to steal your Switch.I would also recommend getting a screen cover, either plastic or glass. I have a glass one that adheres like a second screen and haven't had any trouble yet, but then again I've only had it for 8 days and treat it very carefully.Overall, a great product, and worth every penny!

I am very upset with this situation. I have purchased special editions of any number of consoles. If you buy the special edition of Destiny on PlayStation, you have the game. If you buy the special edition of Halo on Xbox, you have the game. If you buy the Wii Special Edition of Super Mario Bros 25th Anniversary, rest assured, you have the game. The first thing I saw when I opened the box was the message from Nintendo, "GAME NOT INCLUDED". But you do the publication and place it in a VERY SMALL font size and in a recondite place. VERY BAD AMAZON, VERY BAD.

Buying a $300 item on amazon is terrifying! but this was our Christmas gift for my wife's parent and they loved it! it saved us time at the store and it was the perfect gift for them.- Package arrived on time- Box was well padded with those air bubblies- No fingerprints, scratches or damages anywhere on the packaging or the console- Everything was in place and we are happy customers

This console is beautiful! I'm not a huge Animal Crossing fan but the new game did catch my eye even more when this Switch was announced. The pastel colors really work on the Switch, along with the design on the back. What really tempted me to buy this specific one was that it is the second version of the Switch. Which of course includes better battery life. I'm sure you've heard this all before, so I won't go any longer. It's a very pretty console and if you have your chance to get your hands on it for the normal market price. I'd suggest that you go for it!

I got this for my 11-year-old daughter for Christmas and she LOVES it. Turns out my 5-year-old and husband enjoy playing on it as well! It's not a nice size screen and it's really cool that you can play it on the go or hook it up and play on the TV. You do need to make a Nintendo account, though, if you don't already have one in order to play on it, but overall set up was easy and didn't take too long. While the system was expensive it was definitely worth the investment! I do suggest getting a case to keep it in to keep it safe when not in use, though.

This is my second Nintendo switch for my 2 kids. They get to play together at the same time either on TV or on the switch itself in seperate room. One thing that really makes me upset is the digital/download games. You can't download a game in one console (primary) and download the same game in the other console (different profile/account). Nintendo might have found a loophole to prevent losing more money by forcing people to buy second game for second console. Every game must be purchased two times for both Switches if they want to play together. Overall, Nintendo Switch console is worth it.

Great product. Ordered it in the morning, 5 hours later was at my door. We live in beautiful times.Definitely recommend getting a Switch with colored joycons like this one, the black ones are dull and these Red/Blue ones retail for up to $80. Comes with everything you need except a carry case (which I would recommend instead of putting in your backpack lose) as well as picking up a good sized Micro SD card. I got like a 200gb one for $30-40 so I will never lose one of the tiny came cartridges.It's light weight and feels a little fragile, but not cheap feeling. Just wouldn't recommend dropping it like EVER. Anyway, great for all ages like 8-99yo. Bright screen, kick stand is a pain to open at first, but I've used that part like 2 times in 3 months.All n' all, would recommend!

The product was in good condition. However, I purchased what appeared to be a new product. It was wasnt listed anywhere that I would be getting a used item. When my product arrived, I quickly realized that I was sold a used item because I didn‚Äôt have a pin to access any controls. The name of the previous family was listed on the product. I actually would t have minded a used Switch however I need to be able access the product. It‚Äôs very disappointing that I now have to wait over a month for another item.

I had never played an Animal Crossing game before, but after seeing all of the trailers, I knew I had to have it.  I used NowInStock's website to get the red and blue for MSRP about 2 months ago, and have been having a blast with it ever since.  My boyfriend liked it so much he got one from GameStop about 3 weeks ago.  We could not be happier!
I bought this for my Grandkids for Xmas, so happy I got today!! Thanks Amazon as always.  This is what they wanted.  I will update after Christmas.  I love gaming stations.

Since the COVID-19 pandemic, Nintendo Switch has been in incredibly high demand. To have been able to purchase one successfully through a reliable seller (Techool (Seller Fulfilled Ships Fast)), is a blessing. It is pricer now but well worth it, especially while playing and staying at home. It arrived new and in perfect condition. Very happy and pleased with my purchase. Highly recommend!

The product seems pretty good so far. Smaller than I thought as I had never actually seen the device, but the screen is clear, and the first game we bought (Mario karts) had fantastic clear graphics.Controllers are very small and awkward. We might get the more traditional controllers to replace the funny little joy cons.This offer came with a $30 credit that was not applied at delivery. Not sure why they couldn‚Äôt just discount it at purchase. So inevitably it went wrong and I needed to complain - hence dropping a few stars. Now I have a promotional credit that can be applied to eligible items but doesn‚Äôt appear on my account. So basically, don‚Äôt get too excited about the promo offer as it is super painful to get the money.

The only way Nintendo will hear is is through reviews. Limit purchases 1-2 per household. These people buying up special editions and reselling for double the price HAS to stop. DO NOT BUY FROM THEM. Let them sit on the consoles for as long as they possibly can. Nintendo make thousands more please - I beg you. Makes the people lose on their ‚Äúinvestment‚Äù for once.

Got this right before Christmas so our short family vacation during the holiday.  I use it at home and away.  We've got two extra controllers so the whole family can play together games like Mario Party, Mario Kart and etc.  I own several Nintendo game consoles like GameCube and Wii.  I think Nintendo‚Äôs switch is the most incredible system they‚Äôve ever designed.

Delivery was faster than expected (originally it was supposed to take over a month, it instead took ten days). However, I've known someone to recently purchase a Switch and it came 36 hours later and I know someone else that it took over 10 days and decided to just do curbside pickup with Best Buy instead.Otherwise, Switch was perfect.

-1 Star because I hate price gougers, and I normally wouldn't ever support them for something like this, but I was behind the bus on the news about the release on this switch edition and decided if I was going to spend more on it I'd rather do it while it's still reasonable seeing as I was already spotting $700 ones which is outrageous. On another note the item came in pristine condition and as expected is very cute.
Love the limited edition switch! Colors are vibrant and so frigging adorable!

Beware American shoppers. This product came only with a European power cord so my family in the US was unable to use it on Christmas Day. There was no mention of this in the description but needless to say it caused huge disappointment. Amazon and the vendor should be ashamed of misleading customers

The Switch is great and it can be enjoyed by everyone in the family. The only thing I did not like about it is the built-in stand it has on the back. It's very flimsy, keeps coming off and when in use it tends to fall off very easily, so you're probably going to have to look for an additional stand for it to play on some occasions.

We bought this for our son's birthday and we haven't had it for even a year yet and it seems there is a hardware issue. We tried to use three different microSD cards (even the ones manufactured by Nintendo) to add more memory, but none of them worked. Formatting wasn't even an option. We kept getting error messages. I scoured the internet and used every troubleshooting option to no avail. We have only been able to use this Switch very minimally and is now being repaired by Nintendo since it is still under warranty. Also, because of a back up in repairs (due to Covid-19) we won't have it back for a couple months. Wish I could give it a raving review.

Please ONLY buy from Seller Amazon or any other seller that sell at MSRP price and not over outrageous over +$300 price.  You are getting the same console nothing extra.  Overall this is a very good switch system and i love every min of playing it wherever I go.  This new model can also run extra hours compare with the older model.

The switch is the same price as PS4 and it is hard to get. However, in my view it is not as powerful as PS4. Thought it has its own advantage such as small, easy to travel, etc. But, due to the current situation, these are not the points I am looking for. Most of the time, I just play games in my house so I would epect a console more powerful to match the picture quality of my TV. But switch can only play some small games not 3A games.

Nintendo exceeded my expectations with this console, the portability, the quality of the games, the graphics and everything else about it is so great that you wouldn't be able to find any of these things on any other console, I've only played a few hours on Nintendo switch's exclusive games like Mario Odyssey or breath of the wild but even by playing 2 hours with these games you can see how much effort and care went into these games, especially with Mario odyssey.I can't recommend this console enough.

This system is so much fun to use. Battery life is great- the first night I had it I played for almost 6 hours with no issue. It switches seamlessly from handheld to docked. Good price for what you get.

Happy with the product.  This is the revision with the improved battery life, which is a noticeable improvement.  It also has slightly higher brightness and truer color compared to the past model due to a display upgrade.  The only flaw to be aware of is the dock can scratch the screen, which makes a screen protector a must-have.

Le equipo funciona muy bien y sin fallas en mi caso particular el equipo lleg√≥ en una caja de Amazon  todo en una bolsa pl√°stica con otro pedido que vino tinto con eso sin la caja original y sin manual la caja de Amazon era m√°s peque√±a que la caja del Nintendo no entiendo c√≥mo sele ocurri√≥ hacer eso al que realiz√≥ el empaque hice el reclam√≥ y si Amazon se ofreci√≥ a qu√© realizar√° la devoluci√≥n pero era navidad y era un regalo para mi sobrino y tuve que dejarlo as√≠

Got it once it restocked and payed $299 +tax. Had it for a few days now and LOVE it. The colors are great and I'm definitely glad I waited for a restock before setting on the red and blue console. The colors are vibrant yet very pastel. Happy with it so far and setup was easy. It did also come slightly charged so it was quick to turn on and start.
Takes me back to my nitendo days! I just wish it wasn't so expensive!!! Games are $50 each,  extra joycons are $60..... I'm hoping the durability makes up for the huge price tag!
After a few months, I'm noticing joycon drift already. I use it mostly in handheld mode. Battery is superior to the original, but the joycons still suck.
Never connected with my television, has crashed and only shows error messages. basically a lemon.
This was a gift for my grandson, absolutely the only thing he wanted. He was and is delighted with his Nintendo Switch. He can play alone or with others and there are so many games to choose from.

I‚Äôm loving the design and everything else about this switch. This is my first time getting a switch so I can‚Äôt wait to experience a switch while I play animal crossing on Friday with it. I was lucky enough to grab one off amazon on release day before they sold out. If you can somehow get one without paying more than actual retail price then go for this switch and enjoy this beauty as I have.
Not a v2 like the picture or title. it is a v1 switch. not bad price but still alittle more then what I would pay for a v1
My 10y.o daughter very likes it, she said it's like a TV game, but small and can be carried outside. Delivered on time. Thanks.

Basterds won't let me use my credit card on the eShop even though it's legit and works just fine literally EVERYWHERE else... but aside from that, it's great. Just annoyed with Nintendo customer service... as well as my card company- Capital One

Pretty cool little machine, good graphics and unique game cartridge. Really enjoy playing g either handheld or on the tv. Pretty good games. Just missing a few of my favorites but does offer it's own unique Nintendo games

I absolutely love this switch! I‚Äôve been a huge fan of Animal Crossing since the days on GameCube. This is an absolute must for any real Animal Crossing fan. Completely blown away by how great the console looked when I opened it. 10/10 will always recommend!

OMG!!! Finally I see this product is in stock at $299 price. I have been checking it for a while and it last time showed it would be sent by the end of December. Fortunately my delivery time keeps updating and it arrived ahead of scheduleÔΩûAll funtions work well and the game is really interesting. Very good experienceÔºÅ

Got this as a gift for my son. The consel itself is good my son loves it. However the nintendo switch shop membership is pointless and the games are crazy expensive for what they are. I'm not sure I would buy it again. 4bstars cause to my 9yr old it's amazing

this is the console version of driving a lamborghini, honestly gets so much attention due to its exclusivity. really cute pastel colors are very different to anything else we have seen in a switch console and it very pleasing to the eye. I wish it however was more accessible coz at this point i just regret opening this and using it since its so rare. Please restock in large amounts and I would truly give it 5 stars.

We were supposed to get the switch  in October, but we didn't expect them to arrive so soon. I can buy it on 299.99, which makes me very happy. Several friends around me bought it around 370. Both of us are Nintendo fans and that keeps us from stopping to play games.

I had been trying to find a switch ever since quarantine hit, but they were sold out everywhere. This one was about $400 after taxes and shipping, so it was overpriced $100 but it works great and was a lot easier than finding one on offer up. On top of that my delivery was super quick. I would have grave them 5 stars if it wasn't for the price gouge, regardless was worth it.

I bought this unit to exercise with the help of my big screen TV; unfortunately it is not as easy to install as seen in the description.  I read the instruction but still could not install the station to my big screen TV; finally I am thinking to return it to the Seller. This assembly is made of thin plastic so I have to mount it next to the TV; I am afraid that it might break if accidental drop for some reasons. Its weight is quite light compared to other brands; game cartridges are not included and they cost about $50 each.  I am not happy with its performances so far and would not recommend to others.

I love my switch. I was surprised about some of the games offered on the Nintendo store, I never realized the graphics were capable of some of those games (Skyrim, The Witcher 3..etc) battery life is great and it fits comfortably in my hand.

This was a gift for my brother. Was happily surprised when I bought it on back order and it arrived a month before expected, in time for the holidays. So that was pretty awesome. Also it keeps him quiet (he's 20). Same price as everyone else.

Pretty disappointed with the fact that I could find game sold separately anywhere in the sale s ad, so I assumed due to the huge price tag and the fact that animal crossing is all over the box that it came with it. Very unhappy! I feel purposely mislead.
Outstanding special edition nintendo switch animal crossing. If you are a AC fan it is a must have! If you can get 2 and save one for later to sell as these are hard to find at this price!
Love this product, came with everything I needed and worth every penny for it, I play all the time. It's in great condition and they did a great job on packaging so that it would not get damaged.
I was so excited to have gotten the Mario edition. I was able to purchase at its usual price. The case exterior sporting a pattern of recognizable icons.

Got it for my son .... he loves it of course he turned 11 and loves video games like all boys ... enjoys the portable switch as he can take it with him any where he goes .specially .. in the car . It‚Äôs a lovely gift

  ¬†The Nintendo Switch is great at well, switching, no matter if it's on the bus or in the living room, the Nintendo Switch is a great console for the family or the dedicated gamer. This version, the V2, is a big upgrade over the original Switch and has a very noticeable extended battery life compared to the original Switch, with newer joycons included and a brighter LCD screen. Love it, use it everyday!
Bought this and was unaware that it did not come with the game! Guess we were taken for a ride. Definitely price gouging. But lesson learned. Buyer be ware.
Came in pristine condition. My two boys love this thing...so much so I had to buy a second one because they seem to want to play with it at the same time.
Geez, I suck at these games. Now in my 50's I'm trying to work on my reaction time and reflexes and these games on the switch show me how much I suck :)
Grandkids love them so I'm happy

While technologically inferior to the other 2 consoles of this gen, the Switch is hands down the most fun of them all. There are just a gazillion games available and the ability to seamlessly switch from docked mode to portable mode is just priceless. Nothing can beat being able to play your favorite games anywhere you want. Definitely a must buy.
so  I got this for myself in xmas, I wanted it for so long since I love animal crossing, it came quicker than expected and works so fine, I love it.
We like it a lot.  Nintendo's not breaking any new ground here.  The screen is nicer on these new units than my launch version so there's that.
Arrived early and as described!! We are very happy with our purchase. We bought the Switch with red and blue joy cons.

i had the older model and now that i switched to this one (no pun intended) i wouldn‚Äôt go back, back then i had to charge my old switch like 5 times a day under heavy gaming sessions, now i have to worry maybe once! great upgrade and heavily recommended if you mostly play 2d and indie games
We love that we can control the amount of time spent on the device from our smart phone & that there are a variety of games that are family friendly.
best switch yet ü§ß

Usually, I am not one to make a big purchase like this since I am paranoid something will happen to it during delivery but the price was right so I went ahead and bought it. Everything came in perfect condition and the switch works great! I got this as a gift for someone and they loved it. Would definitely recommend purchasing!

There‚Äôs a lot of things I like about the Switch, but at the same time, the limited number of interesting titles makes it a glorified dust collector... whenever I actually do remind myself to boot it up and play the titles I do have.

YESSSS!! AC was awesome to play with it was on Game Cube, so having it for switch is awesome! The colors are amazing and the little bears on the console are cute! The handheld has a great design on the back as well!
Like most other Nintendo systems, works great! Fun games and works well
We've only had them for a week, but one of the joy-cons is already malfunctioning. The right one - the joystick/cam will sometimes spin freely of its own accord. Annoying.

I missed out on the launch and only now have the time to play one. Very happy there were still new mods out there! And this is from the South Asia region, so its an import, not a scalp. Switch is completely regional free too btw
I bought 3 for the grandkids. There are enough free/cheap games to keep them happy. Online parental controls are really nice.
And I was able to get it at market value! Thank you Amazon <3
My kids love the switch! This is the second one we‚Äôve purchased so they wouldn‚Äôt have to share.
Exactly as described. Brand new. Got for my son for Christmas and he is very happy.

I got mine at gamestop. Last one they had without a pre-order and I'm in love. This thing is so beautiful and well made like pretty much everything nintendo makes. I love the pastel color of the joy-cons.

The Switch Lite may fall short in many areas, but this is the one to get. Its an improved original switch, with better battery life. However about 2 hours of battery life is the only difference, so if you find the old switch at a discount price that may be worth getting as well. This one has all the features and you can be sure all games will work with it, unlike the Switch Lite. The Switch Lite isn't worth getting IMO.The biggest pro IMO of the switch is the detachable joy-con's. I have never seen a handheld with detachable joy-con's before this one, and its a huge improvement. If you get sticky buttons, worn out buttons or have a problem with your joy-con's you can just swap them with a new set instead of having to replace the whole handheld. Because of Joy-con drift Nintendo is now fixing Joy-Con's for free so you can buy 2 sets of joy-con's and send one out while the other set is getting fixed. I play Pokemon and a lot of it which requires mashing the A button a lot so I used to find that the A button got worn down much faster than other buttons on previous systems. It was a very complicated procedure to fix this problem on previous handhelds, they didn't come apart too easily if you could get them apart at all. If you tinker or like taking things apart its much easier to take apart a single joy-con and replace a button pad rather than it is to take apart most of a handheld to reach the part that needs to be replaced. This increases the longevity of the system and makes it more durable without having to spend a lot of money on future systems.Its important that you look for the switch with the red box when buying, this is the newer model, the older model comes in a white box. Some places are still selling the older version for the same price as the new.
